channel.title: Comments on: Resources For, And How I Learned Backbone.js

item.title: By: TechNet
item.dc:creator: TechNet
item.description: This is what I wrote, in detail tutorial Backbone.js using coffeescript http://technetlk.blogspot.com.au/2012/09/laravel-backbonejs-coffeescript.html
item.content:encoded:
This is what I wrote, in detail tutorial Backbone.js using coffeescript
http://technetlk.blogspot.com.au/2012/09/laravel-backbonejs-coffeescript.html

item.title: By: Kaha
item.dc:creator: Kaha
item.description: Hey Derick, thank you for your articles. I was searching for some backbone tips, and I found this article which was written recently. Did you see it http://backbonetutorials.com/organizing-backbone-using-modules/ . Idea looks interesting :)
item.content:encoded: Hey Derick, thank you for your articles. I was searching for some backbone tips, and I found this article which was written recently. Did you see it http://backbonetutorials.com/organizing-backbone-using-modules/ . Idea looks interesting :)

item.title: By: Jim Newbery
item.dc:creator: Jim Newbery
item.description: I found I really learned the most when I started testing my Backbone apps. I wrote a series of articles on unit testing Backbone with Jasmine and Sinon.JS which you might find useful.
item.content:encoded: I found I really learned the most when I started testing my Backbone apps. I wrote a series of articles on unit testing Backbone with Jasmine and Sinon.JS which you might find useful.

item.title: By: Anonymous
item.dc:creator: Anonymous
item.description:
thanks for the quick response!
BTW if it helps anyone, another heads-up for these backbone tutorials is the load order of the js files (caught me out first time): jquery, underscore, backbone, yourapp
item.content:encoded:
thanks for the quick response!

BTW if it helps anyone, another heads-up for these backbone tutorials is the load order of the js files (caught me out first time): jquery, underscore, backbone, yourapp

item.title: By: joey beninghove

item.description:
Sorry guys, the original link to the Backbone.js screencast has been restored: http://joeybeninghove.com/2011/08/16/backbone-screencast-introduction-views
Sorry again for the confusion.
item.content:encoded:
